verses.roman:
smaratāṁ kṛṣṇa-vīryāṇi
līlāpāṅga-nirīkṣitam
hasitaṁ bhāṣitaṁ cāṅga
sarvā naḥ śithilāḥ kriyāḥ

synonyms: smaratām—who are remembering; kṛṣṇa-vīryāṇi—the valorous deeds of Kṛṣṇa; līlā—playful; apāṅga—with sidelong glances; nirīkṣitam—His looking; hasitam—smiling; bhāṣitam—speaking; ca—and; aṅga—my dear (Uddhava); sarvāḥ—all; naḥ—for us; śithilāḥ—slackened; kriyāḥ—material activities.
translation: As we remember the wonderful deeds Kṛṣṇa performed, His playful sidelong glances, His smiles and His words, O Uddhava, we forget all our material engagements.
